comments:

Seems strange..
The setCaratOffset method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if you try to set the carat offset inside a multi-byte line delimiter, but we're setting it to text.getCharCount() and I don't think the last character in the console's text widget could be half of \r\n. 
Is it possible that you were printing \r to the console when this happened?
I am not doing that explicitly.  But I could imagine that '\r' does get written to the console.  Sounds like the console might be assuming the the line terminator is a "\n\r", perhaps.

Couldn't we just check the charCount offset to see if it is in the middle of a delimeter? In the event it is, set it to the 'real' end of the line?

will attach patch, with proposed idea.
Marking as works for me. I can't get the problem to happen, and I don't think the patch fixes the problem since the method StyledText.getLine() does not include the line delimiters.
